segments.text: What did you think of the teambuiding session this morning ? Do you think it did much good ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , a lot of the games were pretty silly . I don't know how much it helped us to be a better team , but i think everyone had a good time .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I think that's an important part of it all ... we've got to be able to see another side of our co-workers and boss ... We can see what they're like as real human beings , working together on some project , for fun . I really think it helped our team jell together better .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , I guess you're right . I think the trust game was my favorite . I think in order to have a strong team , we've all got to learn how to trust each other more .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The trust game was your favorite , huh ? My favorite part was the personality tests . I think to know more about what kind of personality type you are will tell you a lot about how you can fit into a team.Also , when you know the personality strengths of your colleagues , it helps you understand them better .
segments.speaker: S1
